interests.descr: My career is an endless learning journey

data.title: Prospecting
data.text: Learn how to ally business knowledge and my tech skills to target valuable information. The main goal is to be fully data driven.

data.title: Data preparation
data.text: Collect, clean and shape datasets to be in the best possible conditions for analysis. For me, the majority of the time is spent on this discipline.

data.title: Data analysis
data.text: Find insights and correlations throught statistical analysis and visualisations. What is fun about it is that we may don't know what we're looking for.

data.title: Machine learning
data.text: I am enthusiastic about ML techniques and when to use the right model, on a given dataset for a given purpose.

data.title: Computer vision
data.text: An important topic impacting nowadays ML techniques and applications. I find this domain quite vast with a multitude of possible uses.

data.title: Cloud computing
data.text: My past experiences with GCP and Azure showed me that ML models can be easily integrated and worked around in such environments.

data.title: CI/CD for ML
data.text: Continuous integration and development in ML field raise new challenges : should we include the model performance in the testing process ? How to deploy it as a service (web, embeded) ? Should we include data in version control ?

data.title: ETL processing
data.text: I realized business knowledge is just as important to design and implement proper ETL pipelines. Data should to be processed depending on who will use them, how often they will be accessed, and the scaling capabilities.

data.title: Software dev
data.text: Provide well-designed code with an ounce of software engineering skills for a better performance and maintainability. A balance between complexity and readability is key.

data.title: Collaboration
data.text: I enjoyed working, creating, exchanging alongside business part in my previous experiences. Maintaining relations is also quite entertaining !
